trans-unit.source: Displays the content of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer"></xref> control.
The ScrollContentPresenter class provides support for styling the various components of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer> control.
For information about the scrolling region inside a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer>, see <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.IScrollInfo>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollContentPresenter"></xref> class.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.AdornerLayer"></xref> on which adorners are rendered.
Adorners are rendered under the clip region of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ScrollContentPresenter> object.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.AdornerLayer"></xref> on which adorners are rendered.
To be added.
To be added.
Indicates whether the content, if it supports <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.IScrollInfo"></xref>, should be allowed to control scrolling.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the content is allowed to scroll; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
A <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> value indicates that the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollContentPresenter"></xref> acts as the scrolling client.
This property has no default value.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ScrollContentPresenter.CanContentScroll*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether scrolling on the horizontal axis is possible.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if scrolling is possible; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
This property has no default value.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether scrolling on the vertical axis is possible.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if scrolling is possible; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
This property has no default value.
Gets the vertical size of the extent.
The vertical size of the extent.
This property has no default value.
Gets the horizontal size of the extent.
The horizontal size of the extent.
This property has no default value.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
Gets the horizontal offset of the scrolled content.
Valid values are between zero and the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ScrollContentPresenter.ExtentWidth%2A> minus the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ScrollContentPresenter.ViewportWidth%2A>.
The horizontal offset.
This property has no default value.
Scrolls the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollContentPresenter"></xref> content downward by one line.
Scrolls the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollContentPresenter"></xref> content to the left by a predetermined amount.
Scrolls the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollContentPresenter"></xref> content to the right by a predetermined amount.
Scrolls the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollContentPresenter"></xref> content upward by one line.
Forces content to scroll until the coordinate space of a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> object is visible.
In most cases, the returned <xref:System.Windows.Rect> is a transformed version of the input rectangle.
In some cases, such as when the input rectangle cannot fit entirely within the viewport, the return value may be smaller.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> that becomes visible.
The bounding rectangle that identifies the coordinate space to make visible.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref> that represents the visible region.
To be added.
To be added.
Scrolls down within content after a user clicks the wheel button on a mouse.
Scrolls left within content after a user clicks the wheel button on a mouse.
Scrolls right within content after a user clicks the wheel button on a mouse.
Scrolls up within content after a user clicks the wheel button on a mouse.
Invoked when an internal process or application calls <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ApplyTemplate*>, which is used to build the visual tree of the current template.
Scrolls down within content by one page.
Scrolls left within content by one page.
Scrolls right within content by one page.
Scrolls up within content by one page.
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer"></xref> element that controls scrolling behavior.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer"></xref> element that controls scrolling behavior.
This property has no default value.
Sets the amount of horizontal offset.
The degree to which content is horizontally offset from the containing viewport.
Sets the amount of vertical offset.
The degree to which content is vertically offset from the containing viewport.
Gets the vertical offset of the scrolled content.
The vertical offset of the scrolled content.
Valid values are between zero and the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ScrollContentPresenter.ExtentHeight*> minus the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ScrollContentPresenter.ViewportHeight*>.
This property has no default value.
Gets the vertical size of the viewport for this content.
The vertical size of the viewport for this content.
This property has no default value.
Gets the horizontal size of the viewport for this content.
The horizontal size of the viewport for this content.
This property has no default value.
To be added.
